text.p: These are the leading stories in the Beirut press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
--Lebanon's Hizbollah says it has no network in Canada. The group also denies any involvement in a bombing in Saudi Arabia last June that killed 19 U.S. airmen and wounded nearly 400 people.
-The constitutional court to rule before the end of the week in appeals lodged by defeated candidates in last summer's parliamentary elections.
-Foreign Minister Bouez: Some Arabs have started cutting normal ties with Israel. Israel cannot keep the benefits of a peace it is destroying.
-Prime Minister Hariri's visit to Turkmenistan concentrated on possible investment opportunities in both countries.
-Maronite Patriarch Sfeir: The Lebanese people are plants that can only survive in an atmosphere of freedom and sovereignty.
